p: Turmeric ( Curcuma longa L.) is a plant native to Southeast Asia that belongs to the Zingiberaceae family. As a powder called saffron, it has been used continuously as a seasoning in vegetarian and nonvegetarian food preparations and also has digestive properties. Its pyriform rhizomes, often short and branched, are home remedies used in folk medicine. The therapeutic properties of turmeric or its compounds include antimicrobial [ 9], antifungal, and antioxidant [ 10] activity. Antileishmanial activity of molecules isolated from C. longa has been described in trial assays to promastigote forms, but there is no data about its effectiveness against intracellular amastigote, the form found in mammalian hosts [ 11].
